page.title: 07Chapelthorpe Hall
page.content: Chapelthorpe Hall, built in the seventeenth century was first owned and occupied by the Worrall family. It passed from the Worrall family to the Beaumont family. The hall is a stone building which used to have mullioned windows but these were later replaced by sash windows. It passed to the Charlesworth family in 1814. In 1847 major alterations to the hall were made by removing the three gables and adding porch to the main entrance. In 1903 parts of the hall were demolished. These included the pantry, butler's room, larder, plate safe, kitchen, scullery, servant's hall and the billiard room. In 1903 the hall passed from the Charlesworth family to the Walker family. The present owner is Mrs.T.F.Manby.
